intro: Sollya drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's sollya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Sollya drummondii is adapted to arid environments and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
